Posts.Content: Diagnosed in Jan/18 invasive ductile carcinoma in lt breast DCIS calcification in rt. Had bilateral wedge resection , stages 0&1 no cancer in any lymph nodes. No family history on either side of any cancers. EST+ prog+ Her2+. Had my head around radiation and tamoxifen.. can't say the same about chemo. Not easy to find stats on what happens to those who refuse. Any words of advice?
Posts.Title: Refusing chemotherapy after Her2+ results

Posts.Content: I am very greatful to you all for taking the time to share your thoughts on this with me. I'm really not very computer savvy, honestly trying to navigate through is almost as frustrating as having breast cancer!    I feel like I'm not at all confident in the Her2+ test result. It seems you can be +, then negative and vice versa. That troubles me.. I have an appointment Monday and have quite a list of questions. Can I request another test.. can I request the oncoyte DX to support the recommendation for chemo. I have found some ladies who were able to just have Herceptin some who were not given the option. I'm pretty sure it will depend on where we live. I am in Northern Ontario Canada. I would like to know the percentages of chance if reoccurring with and without. I believe there are many things I can do to prevent further reoccurrence.. such as completely revamping my diet.. quitting the red wine.. darn it!! So I have my notes, and we shall see next week hiw it all pans out! Again thank you all! And take good care!!  I will post next week after my appointments!
